content.question: A student releases two identical balls off the edge of two different tables. In Figure 1, the student releases the ball from rest at the edge of the table. In Figure 2, the student rolls the ball off the table. The table in Figure 1 is taller than the table in Figure 2. The ball in Figure 1 reaches the ground with speed <math alttext="v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> while the ball in Figure 2 reaches the ground with speed <math alttext="v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. Which of the following statements about <math alttext="v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> must be correct?

choices.label: <math alttext="v sub 1 is greater than v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>
<math alttext="v sub 1 equals v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>=</mo></mrow></msub><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>
<math alttext="v sub 1 is less than v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

The relationship between <math alttext="v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> cannot be determined without knowing the relative heights of the tables and the initial speed of the ball in Figure 2.

content.answer: The relationship between <math alttext="v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> cannot be determined without knowing the relative heights of the tables and the initial speed of the ball in Figure 2.

topic.text: 1.5: Vectors and Motion in Two Dimensions

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
